value.title: Custom sort order for axis, columns, legends.... in Power BI
value.excerpt: How do I sort och change the default order for columns, axis, legends in Power BI?  I get this question all the time, and although I have already explained it in other videos, I don't have a specific video for it and your questions hint me that is needed. value.title: DAX Fridays! #15: SWITCH

value.title: DAX Fridays! #21: USERELATIONSHIP
value.excerpt: A common example in a Power BI table is to have multiple dates, which are related to the same Date table. As you are limited to one active relationship, we need to use the DAX function USERELATIONSHIP to manage the inactive relationships.  Link to Power BI file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/userelationship-dax

value.title: DAX Fridays! #7: ALL, ALLEXCEPT
value.excerpt: The function ALL returns all the rows in a table, or all the values in a column, ignoring any filters that might have been applied. value.title: Deep dive on how to create Power BI themes with a JSON file

This feature (the JSON file) has been available for quite a while but on the September 2017 update of Power BI Desktop, they allow us to

value.title: Differences between Power BI Apps and Workspaces
value.excerpt: In today's video I am going to show you the difference between Power Bi Apps and workspaces and what do I use them for. value.title: Dynamically find header rows and promote them in Power Query
value.excerpt: Dynamically find a column header and promote them in power query is  a very common requirement, specially if you are importing data from excel or pdfs for example.  In today's video, I will show you how to do that with just a few simple steps!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: Get data from zip files without extracting them in Power Query
value.excerpt: In today’s video, I will show you how to unzip files in Power BI. You will be able to import multiple zip files in Power Query and unzip them without having to extract them first.  Here is Marks blog, where you can find his function: http://sql10.blogspot.se/2016/06/reading-zip-files-in-powerquery-m.html
